sub_topic: Calculation of efficiency of a refrigerator
message_1: A refrigerator operates between 0℃ and 30℃ and consumes 150 J of work to remove 500 J of heat from the inside of the refrigerator. Determine the coefficient of performance (COP) of the refrigerator.
message_2:
The coefficient of performance (COP) of a refrigerator is defined as the ratio of the heat removed from the inside (Q_cold) to the work input (W) required to operate the refrigerator. Mathematically, it can be expressed as:

COP = Q_cold / W

Given that the refrigerator consumes 150 J of work (W) to remove 500 J of heat (Q_cold) from the inside, we can calculate the COP as follows:

COP = 500 J / 150 J

COP = 3.33

Therefore, the coefficient of performance of the refrigerator is 3.33.
